author: makortel
body:
Backport of #20362. Description of original PR:

> This PR adds primary vertex resolution via the vertex splitting method to tracking DQM. The resolution is measured separately for the first vertex in the given collection (a clone of `goodOfflinePrimaryVertices` by default) and for the other vertices. Plots include resolutions and pulls of x, y, and z coordinates as
> - inclusive distribution
> - vs. number of tracks
> - vs. sum(pT)
> - vs. number of vertices (in the same collection)
> - vs. instantaneous luminosity (from `LumiScalers`)
> 
> The splitting method uses random numbers to assign the input vertex tracks to two sets. In order to have reproducible results the random number generator is seeded by a combination of event, lumi, and run numbers (anyway the event number is already assigned randomly-enough wrt. the physics content of the event).
> 
> Tested in 9_3_0_pre3, expecting new histograms and no changes in existing histograms.

@rovere @VinInn @sarafiorendi @rmanzoni @mtosi
title: Add primary vertex resolution to tracking DQM (93X)
